item.title: Dtune Beta
item.description:
Dtune is my latest project, still in development. At the moment we have released a working beta that you can visit at dtune.online.

What does it do? It is a collaborative juke-box! Well, that does not really explain everything. The website is entirely static and hosted on github, it uses PubNub in order to publish song information from a streamers and coordinate voters. The desktop version acts as a manager, while the mobile version lists songs and allows the user to vote the next one. In the manager interface, you may login and import your favorite playlist form Youtube. If then you visit the same link on mobile devices or dtune mobile, you will be able to see your “stream”, and vote for the songs.

item.title: Studiospazio
item.description:
The Studiospazio webpage is a full screen gallery with responsive layout and lazyloading of the images.

“Studiospazio is the architectural practice established by Samuele Squassabia, Tao Baerlocher and Eugenio Squassabia. Studiospazio deals with the question of the relationship between architecture and the contemporary reality through projects, competitions, publications and the academic commitment”

The webpage idea came as a collaboration between me and the commmissioner, Studiospazio. It is designed to be simple and to work wit all devices screen sizes and orientations. It features a infinite scroll, with each project containing at least four images, and an action button on top to show description and plans of one studio’s project.

Regarding the implementation, the gallery is created thanks to the awesome and only flickity library, while the lazy loading is achieved with lazysizes Check this project Github repository for the juicy code.

item.title: No Internet Connection
item.description: The Internet is our precious source of information, what would happen if it went down? This Full Page presentation tries to explain it in a not threatening way.

item.title: Forget me not
item.description:
Forgetme tries to answer all of your most paranoid questions regarding your virtual life. Which of your accounts are public on the Internet? What is th degree of privacy which these accounts provide of my data? How easy is to be deleted ?

Forgetme uses Pipl free API to find your email and/or name and it cross-references the most probable results with justdeleteme folder of accounts, rated by privacy and delete policies of the service provider.
